content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

# Julia solution
  function extract_julia_code(md::String)
      lines = split(md, "\n")

      code_blocks = []
      inside_code_block = false
  
      for line in lines
          if startswith(line, "```julia")
              inside_code_block = true
              continue
          end
  
          if startswith(line, "```") && inside_code_block == true
              inside_code_block = false
              continue
          end
  
          if inside_code_block == true
              push!(code_blocks, line)
          end
      end
  
      return join(code_blocks, "\n")
  end

This function iterates through the lines of the markdown document. When it encounters a code block starting with ```julia```, it starts appending each subsequent line to the `code_block` array until it reaches another ``` code fence. It then returns all the extracted Julia code as a single String, joining multiple code blocks together with newlines if there are more than one.
